alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Mineral (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 2:56AM EDT until March 13 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with up to 6 inches along the western facing slopes from Backbone Ridge to the west. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph could result in areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett and Extreme Western Allegany Counties. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Mineral Counties. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM EDT early this morning. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow squalls look to impact the Interstate 68, US-219, US-48, and US-40 corridor later this afternoon and into the early evening hours. Plan for brief periods of reduced visibility and hazardous travel conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
